hook.text: A man spent 25 years in prison for a murder he didn't commit. DNA evidence finally proved his innocence.

buildup.text: The Innocence Project has helped exonerate over 375 wrongfully convicted people using DNA evidence.

discovery.text: Leading causes: eyewitness misidentification, false confessions, junk forensic science, and prosecutorial misconduct.

twist.text: Eyewitness identification is the single largest contributor, involved in over 70% of DNA exonerations.

climax.text: Reforms include recording interrogations, improving lineup procedures, and better forensic oversight.

punchline.text: The system presumes innocence. It doesn't always deliver it.

quiz.question: What is the leading cause of wrongful convictions?
